reviews.review:
With the hours I have, I've obviously gotten my monies worth.

But for those of you thinking of purchasing this DON'T.

The latest update has COMPLETELY broken the survivor experience: Animations, hit-boxes, movement etc.

I honestly can't express in words just HOW MUCH the devs have destroyed this game with the current update.

I just find myself, shaking my head, while I attempt to process the horror of what's unravelling in front of my eyes and consider I may never play this game again.

돈받고 해야할 수준

edit 4: (3/8/22) ive uninstalled the game due to the headaches i get from the black bars and native, oh well

Game design thought I how many eyes?

The recent changes are really unfortunate.   The new survivor animations are inferior to the previously ones (except maybe the crawl). The injured run literally looks like a football player holding the ball.

The new UI is also not an improvement. It adds some useful tracking information oh, but it's all over the place and difficult to look at. The previous UI was much cleaner and simpler.

This point I wish I could but I cannot recommend the game to new folks :(

Devs need to start listening to their community. We make you what you are. Successful. At least have the decency to listen to our feedback and instead of working on what's fun for you, how about you actually fix what needs to be fixed, like the bugs we've suffered with for years, the fat shaming, the broken hit boxes. So what do you give us? A new UI no one wanted or asked for?
???????
EDIT: While also somehow making fat shaming worse, hit boxes even more broken, as well as change it to have absolutely hideous new animations that affects not only the visual aesthetic but also eff up our move and turn speed. The animations were fine, the ui was great. What the actual frig made them think any of this was a good idea? I also don't understand how changing a few animations and the user interface of all things causes so many other seemingly unrelated issues.

this game consistently pisses me off with how inconsistent everything is, Hitboxes are dogshit, you'll get hit through pallets, windows, and sometimes even walls. Unbalanced as all hell but I can't stop playing the game.

Over the years the developers have cemented their inabilities with release after release of broken patches and terrible game design decisions. For years they have "relied" on the use of PTB's (otherwise known as Public Test Builds) in which the playerbase has the option of downloading a temporary version of the game to playtest changes that are being made to the game. The purpose of these builds, as is made clear by the name, is to test the game and give feedback. Or so you would think. However that is not the case when it comes to Dead By Daylight. The balance changes from the PTB to the live version of the game are always incredibly minor and often bring with them (and I'm not exaggerating) MANY, MANY bugs. This can only be the result of a few things. Either the devs are too lazy and/or too incomptent to make the changes and fix the bugs found by the play testers. Or they simply don't care about our feedback.

Thankfully the developers are somewhat open about their development and so we have gotten a fair amount of information regarding who the game designers are and their decision making. Because of this we know that some of them are terribly bad at their own game. Seemingly they are also too stubborn to take the assistance of a myriad of DbD "creators" from YouTube/TwitchTV/etc. who often share their ideas and many of them even publicly making it clear that they are personally willing to help the developers make better game design choices. Instead the devs see their own individual experiences in the game along with some very unconvincing arguments involving their clumsy interpretation of the balance statistics, as the be-all and end-all for balancing.

Balance changes take months and are often very miniscule and disappointing. Something as simple as tweaking the numbers on a perk to nerf or buff it takes the developers months at a time. It is absolutely baffling how slow they are. Even something like a game breaking bug can take weeks to get fixed. Some well known bugs even take months, sometimes years to fix. The developers frequently spend months working on game changes before the community gets a chance to even look at the "suggested" changes. By the time we get to share our opinions on the changes it is already too late to make any adjustments. What they should do is to take the help of the playerbase to make the right decisions before they start working on making them. Instead, what they do, is to waste all of that time working on something that we, the playerbase, already know will be a failure simply by looking at the theoreticals.

I'm not going to comment about the specific game changes that have been made over the years (or the recent changes in particular) that pushed me to write this review. The problems are deeper than the balance issues and the bugs, and it starts with the people making those decisions.

In all the years I have spent playing video games, I have never been more upset and disappointed at a development team than I am at BHVR. I have put almost 3,000 hours into this game playing both killer and survivor because it's actually fun, unique, and addicting. You can play a range of killers that all have unique powers and have their place in the game, or you can play as a survivor with some bomb ass cosmetics. Not to mention the licensing from popular classic horror movies and video games. There is no other game out there that can compete with Dead by Daylight.  However, with each new patch that is released, it has become apparent that the devs do not care about their community. They add killers whose powers are unbalanced, perks that are broken and unfun for both sides, and matchmaking has been in a state of misery making solo q survivor unbearable and killer boringly easy. Each patch is met with new cosmetics and random changes that no one asked for rather than addressing bugs that are game breaking. On top of this, the feedback they receive on their changes are completely ignored. What is the point of releasing a PTB and gathering feedback if none of it matters, and they're going to release the changes anyway? No one wanted graphical updates. No one enjoyed being forced to kick breakable walls to break infinites that have been reintroduced to maps. No one enjoys being hit from 10m away because of desync. No one wanted a new HUD. No one wanted new movement. It hurts to see a development team willingly kill their game because they simply don't care what their community has to say about it when their community is what is keeping the game alive. I have put almost 3,000 hours into this game because I love it, and now I regret ever buying it. Save yourself the trouble, and do not buy this game until the devs show they actually deserve the money you are about to give them.

재밌기만 한 밸런스 개 똥망겜!!!!! 살인마가 일방적으로 쳐 맞는 겜....같은 실력이면 살인마가 이길수가 없는게임...주관적인 생각으로 너스 블라이트 오니 핀헤드를 제외한 살인마를 하면 쳐 맞는 일만 남은 게임....표 해석을 졸라 못하는 개발진들. 올킬율 표를 참고하는건 좋지만 해석을 존나못해서 직쏘랑 고페를 포함한 뚜벅뚜벅이들이 강한줄 알고있음. / behavior 회사 직원만 약 850명인데 대체 핵을 못잡는건지 이해가 가지않음. 850명이 열심히만 일해도 핵은 진작 다 잡고 한달 챕터 한개씩은 내겠다. 너프해놓고 '기뻐하세요!' 이러고 어이가 없는 부분임. 

이 게임은 버그와 핵이외에 아무것도 없다. 

데발진들은 데바데를 공포게임으로 인식하고있음.
